this scale so in terms of data neural network models and deep learning models

so a deep learning model can take days or weeks to go train on a large cluster
of GPUs and so you need a lot of computational firepower and as I mentioned this morning the dirty secret
of machine learning is that once you've gone to the trouble of training these models inferring predictions against
them at scale with low latency is incredibly challenging they typically neural network models
scale very very poorly when you start to put more data through them for inference particularly when you're using things
like a nearest neighbors so as a lot of work goes into scaling for prediction
particularly when you're operating in the sort of scale that we operate out at Amazon so traditionally all of these
areas have been constrained in some way traditionally in old-fashioned data centers literally the data center walls
couldn't move and so you're restricted to the amount of compute and the amount of data that you could store and the
ways that you could do prediction today in the cloud we've been helping customers overcome challenges of scale
for over a decade so we have customers today that have exabytes of data on the platform you'd
be surprised how many startups have exabytes of data available to them today and most new data either from IOT
platforms from web apps mobile apps or pretty much anywhere else is being generated fresh and lives up on AWS and
pretty much everything else is being migrated as aggressively as possible and we have services to help with both

underestimate the bandwidth of a truck full of hard disks speeding down the highway and even our very own truck

we'll bring the truck which has a container full of drives we'll ship it to you you get 24/7 security we'll load

available we have currently we have Kepler Nvidia Kepler GPUs up on AWS but

in some cases the world of training and the world of inference are starting to merge together so we're seeing
adversarial networks which can train each other as they go through the training process and we've seen things
like reinforcement learning where as the model is being run it's actually training itself so chips that you can
run inference and training on at the same time and became more and more important and we'll have those up on the cloud as soon as they become available
from Nvidia later this year they're available with elastic capacity and we have pre-built images of pretty much all
